ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's a solid class for the major

I really loved this class. It was so interesting getting to look at film from a different perspective every week. Professor Glick is a wonderful professor. Unfortunately, he is leaving after this term, but hopefully someone else will pick up this course.
It's hard to recommend this course; it's required and the material is interesting, but the experience of the course was disaffected and lackluster.

I personally love film theory and, while this class seems like it should have a lot, the focus was actually more on the culture and criticism than the theory. I don't know if it will be taught the same way in upcoming years, but if it is, I recommend shopping it and getting a feel for the class structure to see if you enjoy the reading!

Crash course into thinking about film via important texts. Take this course before other courses more focused on certain areas in film (race, gender, sexuality, etc.); otherwise, the class will feel redundant.
